DOC.brief_title: Comparison Slow Efficiency Daily Dialysis ( SLEDD ) With Unfractionated Heparin Versus Citrasate Critically Ill Patients .
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To compare feasibility , safety efficacy Sustained Low Efficiency Daily Hemodialysis ( SLEDD ) use regional anticoagulation Citrasate® compare systemic anticoagulation unfractionated heparin critically ill patient . Design : Prospective , randomize , single-center clinical trial Setting : mixed medical-surgical 45 bed ICU tertiary university hospital Patients : 250 patient Acute Kidney Injury ( AKI ) stage III need renal replacement therapy Interventions : Patients randomize receive SLEDD use standard dialysate systemic anticoagulation UF versus SLEDD use Citrasate®-dialysate additional UF . Measurements main result : Primary end point : - The incidence premature interruption dialysis procedure attribute hemofilter clotting . Secondary end point : - The incidence bleed episode define WHO-criteria - The transfusion requirement - The incidence technique failure - The incidence metabolic derangement ( metabolic alkalosis , metabolic acidosis , hypocalcemia , hypercalcemia , hypernatremia , hyponatremia ) - The incidence citrate intoxication - The dialysis efficiency express Kt/V URR Tertiary end point : - All cause mortality day 28 day 90 inclusion
